About Us

Astronomy and star maps are fascinating topics! Astronomy is the scientific study of celestial objects such as stars, planets, comets, and galaxies, as well as phenomena that originate outside the Earth's atmosphere. Star maps, also known as celestial maps or sky charts, are graphical representations of the night sky that depict the positions and relative brightness of stars and other celestial objects as seen from a specific location on Earth at a particular time.

    — Antoine de Saint

Stars Maps

The universe’s stars range in brightness, size, color, and behavior. Some types change into others very quickly, while others stay relatively unchanged over trillions of years.

Brown Dwarfs

Brown dwarfs aren’t technically stars.

Cheese and Garlic Toast

Far far away, behind the word mountains.

Red Dwarfs

Red dwarfs are the smallest main sequence stars – just a fraction of the Sun’s size and mass.

Neutron Stars

Neutron stars are stellar remnants that pack more mass than the Sun
